Single-cell transformers: BioFormers: Belgadi and Li et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.11.29.569320
Universal Cell Embedding: Rosen et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.11.28.568918
Single-cell transformer evaluation: He et al. 2024	10.1101/2024.01.27.577455	Evaluation of Parameter-Efficient Fine-Tuning (PEFT) for scGPT. Indicates that PEFT not only is more compute-efficient, but also results in better cell type prediction.

Khan et al. 2023	10.1038/s42256-023-00757-8	Focused on imbalanced cell type classification. scBERT is sensitive to class imbalance. scBERT outperforms Seurat. scBERT doesn't perform well in unseen cell type detection. It benefits from SSL pretraining.

Liu et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.09.08.555192	Models aren't trained on the same datasets. scGPT is positioned as most versatile in terms of task diversity that it can tackle. Models other than transformer appear to be at least as good as transformers in most tasks. Transformers were shown to be sensitive to the choice of hyperparameters, such as learning rate and epochs.
Boiarsky et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.10.19.563100	Logistic regression appears to be as good as transformers in cell type annotation, even in low-data scenarios.
Kedzierska et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.10.16.561085	Zero-shot performance only. Both models appear unreliable.
Alsabbagh et al. 2023	10.1101/2023.10.24.563625	Focused on imbalanced cell type classification. Geneformer appears to be outperformed by scGPT and scBERT, where the two latter perform similarly.
